page.title: 10PATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS
page.content: In an area where {COMMUNICATION} is limited to a few lanes and narrow main roads,{FOOTPATHS} and {BRIDLEWAYS} have served an important function in the past. Interviews with elderly residents in {Avening}have shown that the many paths which criss-cross the area have interesting histories. One path at Pound Hill was the site of the former pack-horse trail for the woollen trade. Other paths running towards the Church, have been used by church-goers over the centuries. The wider paths were used by pony and trap and other forms of wheeled{TRANSPORT. Roundabout Lane, which was once a farm track for waggons and hay wains is today a narrow path, almost overgrown in parts. The conditions of these paths vary from those which are stony, dry and clear of vegetation, to those which are barely passable.
